Surveillance nurses screened all outpatients and inpatients at all health facilities in the BHDSS, 24 hours a day, 7 days per week, using standardized criteria for referral to clinicians (Supplementary Table S1). Clinicians applied standardized criteria to make a surveillance diagnosis (Supplementary Table S2) and requested blood culture, chest radiography, NP and OP specimens according to a standardized protocol (Supplementary Table S3). Flocked nylon swabs (Copan, Murietta, CA, USA) were used to collect separate NP and OP specimens
12 .
